identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study to Investigate the Antihypertensive Efficacy of MK0954
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Clinical Study to Evaluate the Antihypertensive Efficacy and Safety of Losartan (MK954, DuP753) in Patients With Mild to

responsibleParty.oldNameTitle: Executive Vice President, Clinical and Quantitative Sciences

descriptionModule.briefSummary: After a 4 week placebo period, patients were randomized to Placebo or Losartan 50 mg arms, after 6 weeks non-responders were up titrated to 100 mg losartan for the remaining 6 weeks. This study evaluated if losartan is more effective than placebo in lowering sitting diastolic blood pressure and is well tolerated in patients with mild to moderate hypertension.

armGroups.description: Losartan 50 mg titrated to 100 mg after 6 weeks

interventions.name: losartan potassium
interventions.description: 50 mg Losartan (MK0954) tablet taken once daily for 12 weeks.

interventions.name: Comparator: losartan
interventions.description: 50 mg tablet of Losartan (MK0954) taken once daily for 6 weeks, Non-responders will then have the dose up titrated to 100 mg for remaining 6 weeks.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Trough Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12
primaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline in trough (24 hours post dose) SiDBP at Week 12
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At baseline and at 12 weeks (24 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Categories of Hypertensive Response in Trough Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 6
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patients with trough SiDBP \<90 mm Hg were in Category I, ≥90 but decreased at least 10 mm Hg were in Category II, and ≥90 and decreased less than 10 mm Hg were in Category III.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Categories of Hypertensive Response in Trough Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patients with trough SiDBP \<90 mm Hg were in Category I, ≥90 but decreased at least 10 mm Hg were in Category II, and ≥90 and decreased less than 10 mm Hg were in Category III.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Trough Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 6
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline in trough (24 hours post dose) SiDBP at Week 6
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At baseline and at 6 weeks (24 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Peak Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 6
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline in peak (6 hours post dose) SiDBP at Week 6
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At baseline and at 6 weeks (24 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Peak Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline in peak (6 hours post dose) SiDBP at Week 12
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At baseline and at 12 weeks (6 hours post dose)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient has been diagnosed with mild to moderate hypertension (SDBP 95-115 mm Hg)
* Patient has no medical problems or treatments that might effect their blood pressure

Exclusion Criteria:

* Pregnant or lactating females
* Patient has secondary hypertension or malignant hypertension
* Sitting systolic blood pressure \> 210 mm Hg
* History of stroke
* History of myocardial infarction with in past year
* Current or prior history of heart failure
* Known hypersensitivity to losartan
* Prior exposure to losartan
* Patients known to be HIV positive
* Patient is abusing or has abused alcohol or other drugs within the past 4 years

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Patients could be randomized after the 4-week placebo baseline period if their mean sitting diastolic blood pressure (SiDBP) was 95-115 mm Hg and ≤7 mm Hg from the mean SiDBP after 2 weeks of placebo therapy
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Patients were recruited at 22 sites in the United States. Prime Therapy Period: December, 1991 to August, 1992.

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: Losartan placebo orally once daily for 12 weeks

groups.title: Losartan 50 mg
groups.description: Losartan 50 mg orally once daily for 12 weeks

groups.title: Losartan 50/100 mg
groups.description: Losartan orally once daily for 12 weeks, initiated as 50 mg and titrated to 100 mg for nonresponders (SiDBP ≥90 mm Hg) after 6 weeks

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Trough Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change from baseline in trough (24 hours post dose) SiDBP at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The primary analysis employed an "all patients treated" approach that included patients with at least one treatment period measurement. The last measurements of withdrawn patients were carried forward to subsequent timepoints. Missing data were estimated by carrying forward data from the last visit (excluding baseline) at which it was available.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: At baseline and at 12 weeks (24 hours post dose)
